item.title: Coronavirus: PM to reveal further details on lockdown roadmap
item.description: Boris Johnson is to face MPs over his plan to reopen society, which were announced on Sunday.

item.title: Coronavirus: French passengers exempt from UK quarantine plans
item.description: The UK government said the new measures would not apply to those travelling from France.

item.title: Iranian navy ship Konarak 'sunk by friendly fire' from frigate
item.description: Iran's navy was reportedly testing a new anti-ship missile when the accident took place.

item.title: Saudi Arabia triples VAT to support coronavirus-hit economy
item.description: The oil-rich kingdom's finances have been rocked after the pandemic forced down global energy prices.

item.title: Project Restart: Premier League facing decisive week over season resumption
item.description: The Premier League is set for a decisive few days in establishing whether it is possible to resume and complete the current season.

item.title: Coronavirus: Sex workers meet clients despite lockdown
item.description: A BBC investigation uncovers evidence that some sex workers are still travelling around the country.

item.title: Primary schools could begin reopening from 1 June
item.description: Boris Johnson says some primary year groups in England could start to return to school.

item.title: Coronavirus: Businesses want 'clear guidance' on return to work
item.description: Trade bodies call on government to set out detailed plans for any easing of lockdown restrictions.

item.title: Coronavirus: Changes to wedding rules 'under consideration'
item.description: The government lockdown has seen couples across the UK cancel or postpone their weddings.

item.title: Coronavirus: High Streets see 'fastest ever' footfall drop
item.description: Springboard says the fall in the number of shoppers visiting UK High Streets was "unprecedented".

item.title: Colombian airline Avianca files for bankruptcy in US court
item.description: The firm said its income has dropped 80% since grounding its fleet due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: HMS Beagle: Dock for Darwin's ship gets protected status
item.description: The submerged mud berth on the River Roach in Essex is recognised as a nationally important site.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: Chaos or freedom? Lockdown roadmap divides papers
item.description: Boris Johnson's unveiling of his plan to reopen society in England dominates Monday's front pages.

item.title: The care home bringing families together during lockdown
item.description: Visits to care homes have been banned across the world but a care home in the Netherlands has found a way to bring people together.

item.title: An activist met someone who sent her abusive messages - what happened next?
item.description: We brought together an angry troll who posts bigoted comments – and one of the people he abuses.

item.title: Coronavirus: Strange days in east London
item.description: Photographer Spencer Murphy talks about the pictures he has been taking during the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Making puppet theatres from lockdown parcel packaging
item.description: How one little theatre inspired children in lockdown onto wonky, mini, homemade stages across the UK.

item.title: The high-flying circus firm for pop and rock stars
item.description: How friends Billy Alwen and Julian Bracey built circus performance firm Cirque Bijou.

item.title: Eurovision: How coronavirus changed the 2020 song contest
item.description: The inside story on this year's cancellation from the artists who were due to sing in Rotterdam.

item.title: Coronavirus: Migrants struggle to send money home
item.description: The Covid-19 pandemic is limiting the ability of people to send and receive money around the world.

item.title: My Money: 'I've gone from being a photographer to a farmer'
item.description: As coronavirus hit, photographer Anna Jackson returned to help her family on their Lincolnshire farm.

item.title: Coronavirus anxiety: How to cope with life after lockdown
item.description: Mental health experts see a new phenomenon - anxiety about going back to a routine after lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: Italy’s other emergency - survivors’ mental health
item.description: Psychologists have seen people with coronavirus symptoms more associated with disasters or war.

item.title: Formula 1 bosses in talks with UK government over quarantine measures
item.description: F1 bosses are in talks with the UK government as to whether new measures to control coronavirus affect plans to re-start the season.

item.title: Third Brighton player tests positive for coronavirus
item.description: A third Brighton player tests positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Aguero stars in Virtual F1, but Poulter's motors steal the show
item.description: Sergio Aguero is good at something else - shock - but Ian Poulter has more Ferraris... probably.

item.title: 'My greatest night': Steve Bunce on Chavez, Haugen, Estadio Azteca and Mr. T
item.description: A Mexican, an American, Mr. T and a record attendance formed part of Steve Bunce's greatest night by a boxing ring.

item.title: 'Moral values should prevail on Newcastle takeover'
item.description: The fiancee of murdered journalist Jamal Khashoggi says Newcastle United and the Premier League must put moral values ahead of financial gains.

item.title: Monday's gossip - Aubameyang in Real Madrid promise
item.description: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang promised grandfather he would play for Real Madrid, Odion Ighalo's Manchester United future in doubt, plus more.

item.title: Gaethje beats Ferguson as UFC resumes behind closed doors
item.description: Justin Gaethje produces the best performance of his career to finish Tony Ferguson and win the UFC interim lightweight title at UFC 249.

item.title: Lockdown update: What are the new rules set out by Boris Johnson?
item.description: With the government easing some restrictions, how will social and work life be different?

item.title: Coronavirus: When will schools reopen?
item.description: Schools have been closed to most pupils since the end of March - when and how will they open?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson has announced changes to guidelines in England on exercise.

item.title: Coronavirus R: Is this the crucial number?
item.description: The number at the heart of the decision whether to lift lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the new quarantine rules?
item.description: What do you need to know if you're planning to fly during the Covid-19 pandemic?

item.title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: How lockdown is being lifted across Europe
item.description: As the UK looks to lift restrictions, how do other European countries plan to re-open after lockdown?

item.title: Coronavirus: Labour's Starmer says PM statement 'raises as many questions as answers'
item.description: People are being told to go back to work without clear safety guidance, Labour leader Keir Starmer says.

item.title: Coronavirus: Should the public wear face masks?
item.description: There is growing discussion about the potential benefits of the general public wearing masks.

item.title: Anna Jarvis: The woman who regretted creating Mother's Day
item.description: She created Mother's Day out of love for her own mother but was shocked by how it became commercialised.
